thread.title: Odell Beckham active vs. Eagles - ESPN
thread.title_full: Odell Beckham active vs. Eagles - ESPN

title: Odell Beckham active vs. Eagles - ESPN
text:
Print Comment 
PHILADELPHIA -- New York Giants wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr . has recovered enough from his hamstring injury that he is officially active and starting for the Giants in a key division game against the Eagles on Monday Night Football. 
After not practicing Thursday or Friday due to the hamstring injury he suffered in the Giants' Week 5 victory over the 49ers, Beckham went through the team's walkthrough workout Sunday and warmed up with the team before Monday's game. It's a chilly night in Philadelphia, with temperatures in the mid-40s, so there was some concern about Beckham's hamstring handling the weather, but he showed enough Sunday and Monday to play. 
Also active for the game is wide receiver Rueben Randle , who suffered his own hamstring injury in the Week 5 game but was able to practice during the week. The Giants have their full complement of wide receivers, minus Victor Cruz , who has been out all year with knee and calf injuries. 
On defense, the Giants are more banged up. Starting cornerback Prince Amukamara (pec) and nickel cornerback Trumaine McBride (groin) are inactive, which means Jayron Hosley is a starting corner while Trevin Wade mans the nickel spot. Defensive end Robert Ayers will miss his fourth straight game with a hamstring injury, and linebacker Devon Kennard is sitting out a second straight game with a hamstring injury of his own. 
George Selvie starts in place of Ayers, and Mark Herzlich starts in place of Kennard. Middle linebacker Jon Beason , who left last week's game with a concussion, will start. 0 Shares
